Garage Door Panel Replacement

Fix dents and damage without buying a whole new door. Seamless color matching.

Get Free Estimate Call (201) 554-6769
Licensed & Insured
10-Year Warranty
5-Star Rated

Signs You Need Panel Replacement

Dented bottom panel
Rotting wood section
Car hit the door
Panel buckling when opening
Rust spots on one section

About This Service

Accidents happen. If you backed into your door or a storm damaged a section, you might not need a whole new door. We can often replace just the damaged panels, saving you hundreds of dollars. We work with all major manufacturers (Clopay, Amarr, Wayne Dalton) to source matching panels. We ensure the new panel aligns perfectly and reinforce the door with new struts if needed.

Why Choose Us?

  • Save Money vs. Full Replacement
  • Restore Curb Appeal
  • Color & Style Matching
  • Reinforcement Struts Included
  • Same-Day Assessment
  • Extend Door Life

Our Process

How we get the job done right

1

Match & Measure

We identify your door's manufacturer, model, and color to find the exact matching panel.

2

Section Removal

We carefully remove the damaged section without disturbing the rest of the door assembly.

3

New Panel Install

We install the new panel, securing it to the hinges and rollers for a seamless fit.

4

Strut Reinforcement

We often add a steel strut to the new panel to prevent future buckling and strengthen the door.

Frequently Asked Questions

Get answers to common questions about this service

Can you match my garage door color for panel replacement?

We work with all major manufacturers to match your door's style and color. For older doors where exact matches aren't available, we provide the closest match possible.

Is it better to replace panels or the whole door?

If only 1-2 panels are damaged and your door is under 10 years old, panel replacement is usually cost-effective. For extensive damage or doors over 15 years old, full replacement often makes more sense.

How long does panel replacement take?

Panel replacement time varies based on the number of panels and complexity. We provide time estimates when scheduling your appointment.

Will replaced panels look different from the rest of my door?

While we match color and style precisely, slight variations may occur due to weathering of existing panels. Over time, weathering will blend the panels together.
